thread.title: Russia says getting 'closer' to deal with US to avoid Syria clashes - Region - World
thread.title_full: Russia says getting 'closer' to deal with US to avoid Syria clashes - Region - World - Ahram Online

author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Russia says getting 'closer' to deal with US to avoid Syria clashes - Region - World
text:
Related Germany warns of risk of US-Russia conflict over Syria US, Russia to hold talks on crowded Syria skies Russian jets bomb 40 ISIS targets in new Syria strikes: Moscow Russia Rosatom says Egypt nuclear station talks in final stages Moscow and Washington are getting closer to agreeing a deal to avoid clashes between their aircraft over Syria, Russia's defence ministry said Wednesday, after a third round of talks between the two countries' militaries .
" Positions became closer on key provisions of the future document," the defence ministry said in a statement to Russian news agencies .
" The procedure for further action by the two sides was agreed," the statement said after a videoconference between the two sides .
Russia and the United States have been making slow progress towards striking a deal on how to stay out of each other's way in the skies over Syria since Moscow launched its bombing campaign in the war-torn country late last month .
The US is spearheading a rival coalition that is bombing ISIS targets in Syria, sparking fears that jets from the two sides could clash .
Russia said Wednesday that one of its fighter jets had approached a US-led coalition warplane in Syrian airspace for identification purposes .
US Colonel Steven Warren, spokesman of the US-led coalition, had said earlier that the planes had come "miles apart" on Saturday, prompting fears that crowded skies over Syria could lead to mid-air collisions .
The US and its allies have sharply criticised Moscow's intervention in Syria, insisting that Russian strikes are primarily targeting more moderate groups battling Assad and not IS jihadists .
Russia has lashed back fiercely at the criticism by saying that it has been pushing the US to cooperate but received no response from Washington .
